The most realistic and best WWII shooter Valve has to offer in the Source engine. However, getting kills and/or objectives aren't easy. However, as long as you have patience and really enjoy the WWII atmosphere of this game, I guarantee you'll have fun playing this game at least every now and then.

The FitnessGram™ Pacer Test is a multistage aerobic capacity test that progressively gets more difficult as it continues. The 20 meter pacer test will begin in 30 seconds. Line up at the start. The running speed starts slowly, but gets faster each minute after you hear this signal. [beep] A single lap should be completed each time you hear this sound. [ding] Remember to run in a straight line, and run as long as possible. The second time you fail to complete a lap before the sound, your test is over. The test will begin on the word start. On your mark, get ready, start.

Valve's forgotten IP. It's a shame because Day of Defeat was a unique take on the WW2 shooter at the time, but unfortunately it was overshadowed by more popular WW2 shooters and promptly abandoned. It would be cool to see a new entry in this series at some point but if that ever happens, there will always be Day of Infamy instead.

It's worth noting that this game does still have an active community, if you're wondering. That's the main reason I'm still recommending it. It's a fairly small community, but you won't struggle to find active servers with a number of players on them. Definitely worth checking out if you already have the game, and if you want to experience it yourself I'd probably recommend just getting the game on sale - you probably won't be playing it a lot.

Of course, the other reason to get this game is for Garry's Mod content. It's not required for any addons that I can think of but you can load the maps and models into sandbox if you want to do that, for some reason.

J'ai commencé à jouer à ce jeu il y a fort longtemps ; ce que j'apprécie ici est la diversité de communautés, entre les RP et les franchouillards blagueurs, sans compter les fameuses Snow maps de Gandhi77. En 6-7 ans de jeu, rien n'a changé (de mon point de vue du moins) et c'est ce que j'aime : DoDS ouvre une porte sur le passé, avec un jeu te une communauté que l'on ne peut trouver ailleurs. Vive DoDS !

GREAT GAME, absolutely awesome, i love ww2 and everything about it, but i have some gripes
1) its a bit outdated as in its a carbon copy of half life and its menus are too, but thats allright, i prefer that
2) even at max setting, it looks really good but if you look close you can see the polygons
3) not enough class choices, as where are my luger classes, etc
4) no other playing options like using warships or tanks, which could revive the game entirely (seen by pavlov)
 
BUT they have mastered what is already here, but so have the players, there are some players that are absolutely godlike, and im not gonna lie, the bots AI is out of this world, they are better than me, and ive played valve games for nearly a decade now, i have thousands of hours in valve games

id rate it a solid 8.5/10

Classic shooter

After twenty years this game still has a strong community. Most people I played with as a teen are now adults and it's kind of heartwarming to see each other again after so many years we all got married and have families. It's really beautiful. 

I don't think it happens with other games where communities renew. This game appealed to a generation back then and it stayed loyal to it throughout the years. 

Naturally we would all have moved to DOD: Source by now but DOD:S is an incomplete game with a weird feel to it. It's not the same. 

If you are in your 30s and like to play among other adults, this game is definitely for you.

Day of Defeat: Source is a surprisingly fun trip back to that classic feeling of mid-2000's Source engine multiplayer deathmatch. While obviously not especially good-looking nowadays, for its time it's presentation and audio design were top notch. As in the original Day of Defeat the gameplay is quite punishing and sticking your head out of cover for more than a split second is a sure fire way to get it blown off. While the learning curve in adjusting to the gameplay's punishing qualities may put some players off, for others it adds an extra layer of challenge to a multiplayer selection that is often stagnant with health-regenerating Call of Duty clones. In my opinion, however, the grenades are somewhat overpowered and I have spent many death cycles wondering how the small, barely-visible metal cylinder thrown from halfway across the map 20 seconds ago possibly managed to kill me. Nevertheless, I greatly enjoy this game as a relaxing way to waste some time with some good old-fashioned WW2 shooter action.

DOD: Source may be a decently old game however it is super fun. If your into first person shooters and world war 2 than this game might be for you. There's a bunch of community maps and some are of actual battle from WWII. The game itself is really good, If your wondering about the community its like COD, only instead of toxic 9 year old's, its toxic 30 year old's. That's true in some cases but if you wanna get the game just do it. Its worth it.

Bad PC? Dont want your laptop to over heat? Bad wifi?

THIS GAME IS JUST FOR YOU.
